intro: Pedicularis hallii, commonly known as the Hall's lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems and showy, bilaterally symmetric flowers that range in color from yellow to red. It typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in well-drained, rocky soils. Pedicularis hallii plays a role in its ecosystem by providing nectar to pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
